content:
TITLE: Installing Decap CMS App via NPM
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to install Decap CMS App using npm, including the required peer dependencies (React and ReactDOM), and shows how to import and initialize the CMS in JavaScript.
SOURCE: https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/blob/main/packages/decap-cms-app/README.md#2025-04-15_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm i react react-dom decap-cms-app
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import CMS from 'decap-cms-app';

CMS.init();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Decap CMS App via Script Tag in HTML
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement Decap CMS App using script tags at the bottom of an HTML body. This approach includes loading React and ReactDOM from CDN before the Decap CMS App script, followed by initializing the CMS.
SOURCE: https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/blob/main/packages/decap-cms-app/README.md#2025-04-15_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<!-- Excluding `doctype` and `head` but you should add them -->
<body>
  <!-- Add these scripts to the bottom of the body -->
  <script src="https://unpkg.com/react@^18/umd/react.production.min.js"></script>
  <script src="https://unpkg.com/react-dom@^18/umd/react-dom.production.min.js"></script>
  <script src="https://unpkg.com/decap-cms-app/dist/decap-cms-app.js"></script>
  
  <!-- Initialize the CMS -->
  <script>
    DecapCmsApp.init();
  </script>
</body>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Debugging HTML template for Decap CMS
DESCRIPTION: Basic HTML template to load Decap CMS from the dist folder for debugging with optional customization section.
SOURCE: https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-15_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <meta charset="utf-8" />
    <title>Decap CMS</title>
  </head>
  <body>
    <script src="dist/decap-cms.js"></script>
    <!-- <script>
      // this is the place to add CMS customizations if you need to, e.g.
      CMS.registerPreviewTemplate('posts', PostPreview);
    </script> -->
  </body>
</html>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting localStorage for Git Gateway Debugging
DESCRIPTION: Commands to set the Netlify site URL in localStorage for debugging the CMS with Git Gateway locally. This is necessary to connect your local development environment to your Netlify-hosted identity service.
SOURCE: https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/blob/main/packages/decap-cms-backend-git-gateway/README.md#2025-04-15_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
localStorage.setItem('netlifySiteURL', 'https://yourwebsiteurl.netlify.app/')
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
localStorage.getItem('netlifySiteURL')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Registering a Locale in Decap CMS
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to import a specific locale (German in this example) from the decap-cms-locales package and register it with the CMS. This enables the CMS interface to be displayed in the registered language.
SOURCE: https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/blob/main/packages/decap-cms-locales/README.md#2025-04-15_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import CMS from 'decap-cms-app';
import { de } from 'decap-cms-locales';

CMS.registerLocale('de', de);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: GitHub backend configuration for Decap CMS
DESCRIPTION: Example configuration for the GitHub backend in the config.yml file for debugging.
SOURCE: https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-15_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: js
CODE:
```
backend:
  name: github
  repo: owner-name/repo-name
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Decap CMS dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Commands to clone the repository and install dependencies for the Decap CMS project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-15_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms
cd decap-cms
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Decap CMS locally
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the development server for local development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-15_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npm run start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing File System Objects for Decap CMS Demo Backend in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows the implementation of the File Management System API for the demo backend. It uses two JavaScript objects: repoFiles for the main file-system tree structure and repoFilesUnpublished for storing unpublished files in a flat list format.
SOURCE: https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/blob/main/packages/decap-cms-backend-test/README.md#2025-04-15_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
window.repoFiles // json file-system tree
window.repoFilesUnpublished // flat file list
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building and previewing Decap CMS
DESCRIPTION: Script to build the CMS packages and serve the resulting build locally.
SOURCE: https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-15_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npm run build-preview
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Describing Bitbucket Backend Structure in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet outlines the main components of the Bitbucket backend for Decap CMS, including the Implementation, Api, and AuthenticationPage. It also mentions the use of pull request comments for tracking unpublished entries in the Editorial Workflow.
SOURCE: https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/blob/main/packages/decap-cms-backend-bitbucket/README.md#2025-04-15_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# Bitbucket backend

An abstraction layer between the CMS and [Bitbucket](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/azure/devops/git/)

## Code structure

`Implementation` for [File Management System API](https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/tree/main/packages/decap-cms-lib-util/README.md) based on `Api` and `LargeMedia(LFS)`. With [Editorial Workflow](https://www.decapcms.org/docs/beta-features/#gitlab-and-bitbucket-editorial-workflow-support) uses pull requests comments to track unpublished entries statuses.

`Api` - A wrapper for Bitbucket REST API.

`AuthenticationPage` - uses [lib-auth](https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/tree/main/packages/decap-cms-lib-auth/README.md) to facilitate OAuth and implicit authentication.

Look at tests or types for more info.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Proxy Backend in YAML
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for connecting your CMS to the proxy server, specifying the backend name, proxy URL and target branch.
SOURCE: https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/blob/main/packages/decap-server/README.md#2025-04-15_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
backend:
  name: proxy
  proxy_url: http://localhost:8081/api/v1
  branch: master # optional, defaults to master
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Debugging Cypress Tests for Decap CMS
DESCRIPTION: These commands start a local dev server with the demo site and run Cypress in non-headless mode with mock data for debugging purposes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/blob/main/cypress/Readme.md#2025-04-15_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run develop
npm run test:e2e:exec
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: GitHub Backend Components Overview
DESCRIPTION: Key components of the GitHub backend implementation: a wrapper for proxied GitHub access and an authentication page compatible with AWS Cognito using PKCE.
SOURCE: https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/blob/main/packages/decap-cms-backend-aws-cognito-github-proxy/README.md#2025-04-15_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
Implementation - wraps [Github Backend] for proxied version of Github.

AuthenticationPage -  uses [lib-auth] to create an AWS Cognito compatible generic Authentication page supporting PKCE.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Decap CMS packages
DESCRIPTION: Script to clean and build all CMS packages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-15_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npm run build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Recording Cypress Tests for Decap CMS
DESCRIPTION: These commands start the local dev server, recording proxy, and run Cypress in non-headless mode to record test fixtures.
SOURCE: https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/blob/main/cypress/Readme.md#2025-04-15_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run develop
npm run mock:server:start
npm run test:e2e:record-fixtures:dev
npm run mock:server:stop
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Environment Variables for Proxy Server
DESCRIPTION: Environment variable configuration for customizing the Git repository path and port number for the proxy server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/blob/main/packages/decap-server/README.md#2025-04-15_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# optional, defaults to current directory
GIT_REPO_DIRECTORY=FULL_PATH_TO_LOCAL_GIT_REPO
# optional, defaults to 8081
PORT=CUSTOM_PORT
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Cypress Tests in Headless Mode for Decap CMS
DESCRIPTION: This command builds the demo site and runs Cypress tests in headless mode using mock data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/blob/main/cypress/Readme.md#2025-04-15_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run test:e2e
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Environment Variables for Backend API Access
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the structure of the .env file required for recording tests with access to various backend APIs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/blob/main/cypress/Readme.md#2025-04-15_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
GITHUB_REPO_OWNER=owner
GITHUB_REPO_NAME=repo
GITHUB_REPO_TOKEN=tokenWithWritePermissions
GITHUB_OPEN_AUTHORING_OWNER=forkOwner
GITHUB_OPEN_AUTHORING_TOKEN=tokenWithWritePermissions

GITLAB_REPO_OWNER=owner
GITLAB_REPO_NAME=repo
GITLAB_REPO_TOKEN=tokenWithWritePermissions

BITBUCKET_REPO_OWNER=owner
BITBUCKET_REPO_NAME=repo
BITBUCKET_OUATH_CONSUMER_KEY=ouathConsumerKey
BITBUCKET_OUATH_CONSUMER_SECRET=ouathConsumerSecret

NETLIFY_API_TOKEN=netlifyApiToken
NETLIFY_INSTALLATION_ID=netlifyGitHubInstallationId
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Decap CMS tests
DESCRIPTION: Script to run linting and Jest tests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-15_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```

```

TITLE: Importing Test Utilities in Cypress Specs
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to import utility files into individual Cypress test specifications. The example shows importing a local backup dismissal utility.
SOURCE: https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/blob/main/cypress/utils/README.md#2025-04-15_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import '../utils/dismiss-local-backup';
```

TITLE: Object Widget Version 2.3.0 Feature Notes
DESCRIPTION: Release notes for version 2.3.0 documenting code and markdown widget overhaul
SOURCE: https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/blob/main/packages/decap-cms-widget-object/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-15_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# [2.3.0] (2019-12-16)

### Features

* check for title/slug field on config load ([@tech4him1](https://github.com/tech4him1) in [#1203](https://github.com/decaporg/decap-cms/pull/1203))
```
